org.usfirst.frc.team3494.robot.subsystems

Class Drivetrain

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.command.Subsystem
      • org.usfirst.frc.team3494.robot.subsystems.Drivetrain
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.NamedSendable, edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Sendable, IMotorizedSubsystem

    public class Drivetrain
extends edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.command.Subsystem
implements IMotorizedSubsystem
    Drivetrain subsystem. Contains all methods for controlling the robot's drivetrain. Also has in instance of RobotDrive (wpiDrive) if you want to use that.
    Since:
    0.0.0

        public edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.RobotDrive wpiDrive

      • initDefaultCommand

        public void initDefaultCommand()
        Specified by:
        initDefaultCommand in class edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.command.Subsystem

      • TankDrive

        public void TankDrive(double left,
                      double right)
        Drives the drivetrain tank drive style. The drivetrain will continue to run until stopped with a method like stopAll().
        Parameters:
        left - The power to drive the left side. Should be a double between 0 and 1.
        right - The power to drive the right side. Should be a double between 0 and 1.

      • adjustedTankDrive

        public void adjustedTankDrive(double left,
                              double right)
        Drives the drivetrain, with the value passed in for left inverted. This corrects for the left side being inverted hardware side.
        It works if you don't think about it too hard.
        Parameters:
        left - The power to set the left side to. This will be multiplied by -1 before getting to the Talons.
        right - The power to set the right side to. Just goes straight to the Talons.

      • getRightDistance

        public double getRightDistance(UnitTypes unit)
        Gets the distance the right encoder has counted in the specified unit.
        Parameters:
        unit - The unit type to get the distance in.
        Returns:
        The distance the right encoder has counted, in the specified unit.

      • getLeftDistance

        public double getLeftDistance(UnitTypes unit)

        public void resetRight()

      • setAll

        public void setAll(double speed)
        Description copied from interface: IMotorizedSubsystem
        Sets all motors on a subsystem to a given speed. (Example use: driving forward)
        Specified by:
        setAll in interface IMotorizedSubsystem
        Parameters:
        speed - The speed to set the motors to.
